content.description: Sit start on left side, climb under the roof using arete and up into the prow.
content.protection: Pads, Spotter would be good. Mind the boulder behind you.

content.description: Start on a good right hand pinch and left any of the crimps. Pull up into a good heel hook and pump left hand up twice then heel the right and go for the top. Very fun movement for this short problem!
content.location: a few hundred feet down from Mean Gurlz. If your looking down from Mean Gurlz it is on the left side of the talus down until the talus fades into woods.

content.description: Sit Start under the boulder with two good edges on the face, feet out left. Make a left hand move up to the next good edge, then move out to the right hand side pull. Then get your feet set to make the bump up to the right hand jug. Make one more move to the to a left hand jug and top it out. Hardest part of this boulder is not dabbing on the boulder next to you, it gets a bit cramped.
content.protection: 2 pads would do you some good, one to stick in the hole and one to lay over the top.
content.location: Just below Mean Gurlz by maybe 75 yards? and just Above Par 4.

content.description: From a sit with your arms wide, left hand on a low downpulling edge, right on a low and thin sidepull, pull on and go up the face.  Tough first move and fun delicate climbing on perfect rock.  A 5 move problem or so.
content.location: 200 feet north of Mean Gurlz almost at the same level in the talus field in a mini corridor.  The problem faces north.  It is 100 feet below the thin man corridors in the talus.  The thin man corridors are at the dominant look out just before you get to Monolith walking along the trail.

content.description: start using good edges to work your way up the right side of the large slab, utilizing ample feet and then the usual devil's lake high step to an excellent top out jug.
content.protection: pads and a spotter, climb is situated on a generous, though precarious, ledge so that is why i gave it the PG 13, otherwise standard issue boulder problem.
content.location: about 50 vertical feet below the "thin man corridor" and a little south, near bonamici arete (about 50-100 feet south of that climb). look for a large slab facing the lake with the obvious ledge protruding from beneath.
